column4: Hey everyone, I just upgraded my computer and I'm wondering; which works better, migrating a ubuntu install to another, larger partition, or trying to enlarge the partition on the drive it's on?
I would just istall on the new drive and then copy files over from the old drive (or partition). But if you have alot of config stuff you don't wnat to have to redo, then just try to resize
then just resize your current parition if you have available disk space.
